Coverage increased (+0.05%) to 69.553% when pulling **0d5aa3fdcd598d7043ab2e0cf1050ed991e684e7 on robertwb:ulr** into **50532f0a92d7ce8dbbdc6c3179ab7b9efde6a746 on apache:master**.

To summarize the discussion: 

A Universal Local Runner is one that can run pipelines in any language based on the proto definition of a pipeline, spinning up workers (as subprocesses, containers, or similar.) This can be useful to have in more than one language (e.g. for testing, development, ...) just as it's useful to have multiple direct runners. 

We also want a reference implementation, which will be a ULR, and there is a preference to have this written in Java in case it's useful for other runners (currently all in Java) to borrow code/ideas.

I'll open a new PR with a fix for that.
